Row.Text: The Obsidian Warrior is a Mayan unique unit of the Classical era. Unlike the Swordsman it replaces, it has a 50% bonus against mounted units. This bonus is not lost upon upgrade.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires 1 [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron.
Anti-mounted melee unit. Only the Mayans may build it.

Although the Maya had projectile technology, such as the atlatl and spear, much of the actual fighting was done at close range with "thrusting, stabbing, and crushing". Weapons were crafted mostly from obsidian and chert, obsidian (a naturally-formed volcanic glass) being the sharpest. Obsidian was a highly integrated part of daily and ritual life, and its widespread and varied use may be a significant contributor to Mesoamerica's lack of metallurgy.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The maquahuitl was sharp enough to decapitate a man and, according to an account by a Spanish conquistador, it could even decapitate a horse. Another account by a companion describes a similar story of its effectiveness:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I saw one day an Indian fighting with a mounted man, and the Indian gave the horse of his antagonist such a blow in the breast that he opened it to the entrails, and it fell dead on the spot. And the same day I saw another Indian give another horse a blow in the neck, that stretched it dead at his feet" — Offensive and Defensive Arms, page 23
